definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: He 's an army sergeant. He needs a loud voice.
sentences.chinese: 大嗓門，因爲他是個軍士。

sentences.english: Dancing shakes, his voice is high, the carnival night is yours.
sentences.chinese: 舞姿搖搖，嗓門高高，狂歡夜任你逍遙。

sentences.english: Her loud voice cut across their conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的高嗓門打斷了他們的談話。

sentences.english: Lift your voice so that everyone can hear you with ease.
sentences.chinese: 把嗓門提高，讓大家都能毫不費力地聽清你的話。

sentences.english: Then, raising her voice, “Piotr, are you in there?”
sentences.chinese: 接着，提高了她的嗓門，“彼得亞雷，你在家嗎？”

sentences.english: "That is correct, " it said in its mechanized little voice.
sentences.chinese: “你說得對，”機器人用他那機械化的小嗓門說道。

sentences.english: His harsh voice grates on our ears.
sentences.chinese: 他的粗嗓門兒使我們感到刺耳。

sentences.english: But his loud voice scared the little mouse away.
sentences.chinese: 但是他的大嗓門已把小老鼠嚇跑了。

sentences.english: There are some cannoneers nearly as noisy as their own guns.
sentences.chinese: 有些炮手的嗓門幾乎跟他們的大炮一樣響。

sentences.english: Her voice thinned down to a whisper as people turned to shush her.
sentences.chinese: 當人們回過頭來噓她時，她就放低嗓門講話了。

sentences.english: John is a mild ma new great who never raises his voice.
sentences.chinese: 約翰是一個溫和的人，他從不舉高嗓門說話。
孩子們拉開嗓門使勁唱。

sentences.english: "Where are you from?" boomed a voice.
sentences.chinese: “你是從哪兒來的？”一道嗓門震天響的聲音問道。

sentences.english: They have loud voices and often use them.
sentences.chinese: 她們有着一副大嗓門，而且經常聒噪。

sentences.english: I could hear the gruffer voices of adults arriving on the scene.
sentences.chinese: 我聽見現場有了大人們粗啞的嗓門兒。

sentences.english: Paranoid nationalists may have bigger mouths, but they have no influence on policy.
sentences.chinese: 偏執民族主義者可能嗓門更大，但他們無法影響政策。
